title: With Gretzky on hand, Ovechkin scores 893rd
content: Capitals star Alex Ovechkin scored his 893rd career goal Friday night against the Blackhawks to move one back of tying and two away from breaking Wayne Gretzky's NHL record.

title: Buffs coach: Stars 'should be going 1-2' in draft
content: Deion Sanders says quarterback Shedeur Sanders and Heisman Trophy winner Travis Hunter -- the marquee players of Friday's Colorado Showcase -- have confirmed that they are the top two players in this year's NFL draft.

title: Phils' Harper: Loser talk to whine about Dodgers
content: Phillies slugger Bryce Harper loves L.A. -- well, at least the World Series champion Dodgers' freewheeling spending on their way to a nearly $320 million payroll.

title: Jackson-Earnhardt Jr. trademark dispute resolved
content: A trademark dispute between Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson and motorsports star Dale Earnhardt Jr. has been resolved.

title: Sources: Chargers add QB Lance on 1-year deal
content: Former Cowboys and 49ers quarterback Trey Lance reached agreement on a one-year deal worth up to $6.2 million with the Chargers, sources told ESPN.

title: 7-time Pro Bowl receiver Jones officially retires
content: Julio Jones, a 7-time Pro Bowl pick who is the Falcons' all-time leader in receptions and receiving yards, has retired. He last played for the Eagles in 2023.

title: Duke's Brown not 100% but expects bigger role
content: Duke's Maliq Brown, after dislocating his left shoulder, said he's ready for a bigger role in the Final Four following limited minutes in NCAA tournament wins last weekend.

title: Golfer tapes mouth shut to quell angry outbursts
content: Korn Ferry Tour golfer Ryan McCormick decided to control his anger by taping his mouth shut during Friday's round. Said McCormick: "I just figured I'd shut myself up."

title: Breaking down all four women's Final Four teams -- and predicting the 2025 national champion
content: No. 1 seeds UCLA, South Carolina and Texas advanced to Tampa. But 2-seed UConn has momentum and experience.

title: 'What the heck have we done?' Inside 48 hours of torpedo bat madness
content: From a comment on a Yankees broadcast to a rush of new bat orders, here's how MLB's hottest trend took off.

title: More than the game: Dawn Staley's impact on the places she has called home
content: No matter where she's called home, the Final Four coach's story is held close by those who watched her rise.

title: How Gabriela Jaquez shifted focus during Final Four run
content: Gabriela Jaquez is chasing history with UCLA after spending her summer doing the same with Team Mexico.

title: How Nikola Jokic quietly became a defensive analytics darling
content: From kicked ball violations to memorizing plays, Jokic has become one of the league's best defenders.

title: Playoff watch: Last stand for the Red Wings?
content: It's close to do-or-die time for Dylan Larkin & Co. Plus, updated playoff bracket, draft lottery projections.

title: Johni Broome could be 'the most impactful transfer in college basketball history'
content: The SEC Player of the Year is chasing history -- for himself and Auburn -- as the Tigers head into Final Four.

title: Duke's baton now fully passed from Coach K to Jon Scheyer
content: Mike Krzyzewski's emergence from the shadows is the ultimate sign that the baton in Durham has been passed.

title: Long snapper rehearses business pitch for Deion Sanders, teammates
content: Camden Dempsey, who launched an insurance company on Thursday, got some extra help in a team meeting.

title: Amorim: 'Crazy' to believe Man Utd could win Prem
content: Ruben Amorim said he would be "crazy" to think Manchester United can win the Premier League next season.

title: Depleted U.S. to experiment in Olympic rematch
content: USWNT coach Emma Hayes said she feels confident in her team's defensive personnel ahead of an Olympic gold medal-game rematch against Brazil, despite the "extremely unfortunate" injury to center-back Tierna Davidson.

title: Musiala scores, suffers injury in Bayern win
content: Bayern Munich came back from a goal down to beat hosts Augsburg 3-1 on Friday and move nine points clear at the top but the Bundesliga leaders saw Jamal Musiala taken off injured ahead of next week's Champions League quarterfinal.

title: Ancelotti: Olmo clearance doesn't mar LaLiga
content: Real Madrid coach Carlo Ancelotti does not believe the decision to allow Barcelona's Dani Olmo and Pau Víctor to continue playing for the club will taint any competition, with his team potentially facing Barça for three trophies.

title: Mbappé, Rüdiger avoid bans; available vs. Arsenal
content: Real Madrid's Antonio Rüdiger and Kylian Mbappé have been cleared by UEFA to play for next week's Champions League quarterfinal first leg at Arsenal.

title: Spirit's Kang invests $25M for women's soccer
content: Washington Spirit owner Michele Kang announced on Friday that she is handing over her female athlete innovation hub and making an additional $25 million investment to support U.S. Soccer's efforts.

title: 2014 World Cup winner Mats Hummels to retire
content: Germany and Roma centre-back Mats Hummels will retire at the end of the season, the 2014 World Cup winner said on Friday.

title: Safety? Aesthetics? Competitive advantage? The real reasons some teams want to ban the tush push
content: It wasn't just about a polarizing on-field rule. It was a window into the back-channel politics of the rules process.

title: Tatum? Pippen? NBA execs share best comps for projected No. 1 pick Cooper Flagg
content: Ahead of the Final Four, NBA execs share their comparisons for the Duke star and projected No. 1 draft pick.

title: Brooklyn to Indiana: Darryn Peterson's 48-hour run
content: After shining in the McDonald's All American Game, the Kansas commit inspired a Chipotle Nationals win.

title: 'The most unique quarterback story I've ever heard': How Luis Perez became 'The Spring King'
content: UFL QB Luis Perez has chronicled his unique journey in a book as he pushes for a final chapter in the NFL.

title: UFC Fight Night expert picks, best bets: How Lerone Murphy remains unbeaten
content: Who prevails in this week's UFC Fight Night and PFL First Round? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: The next big thing: Day is embracing his new 'job' in NASCAR
content: Outside of dirt races, Corey Day's schedule used to be wide open. That's not the case now that he's in NASCAR.

title: Why the Manchester derby lost its cachet, and how it might be coming back around
content: Sunday's Manchester derby will be the lowest-key edition in some time. How did we get here, and when might it get back to the thrilling matchup it once was?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United make Italy striker Lucca new target
content: Udinese and Italy striker Lorenzo Lucca has emerged as a leading summer target for Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Trump's China focus may open fresh opportunities for India
content: Indian officials face challenges in trade negotiations with Asean due to the presence of Chinese companies in the bloc. The issue echoes global concerns, particularly for the US, which has implemented high tariffs to curb Chinese economic dominance. This scenario complicates trade dynamics, especially with recent tariff retaliations from China.

title: Trump’s tariff war triggers $5tn wipeout as US markets suffer worst week since 2020
content: A $5 trillion loss hit Wall Street as the S&P 500 dropped 6% after Donald Trump’s tariff hikes sparked fear of a global recession. China's retaliatory tariffs intensified market losses. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell warned of higher inflation and slower growth, while Trump remained defiant, labeling the economic turbulence as necessary for correcting trade imbalances.

title: PM Modi-Yunus meet: B’desh says reports of attacks on minorities ‘hugely inflated’
content: PM Modi urged Bangladesh's chief adviser Muhammad Yunus to ensure the safety of minorities and investigate violence against them. Yunus called for a reality check on social media reports and emphasized non-interference. The meeting also discussed extradition issues, border security, and the potential for a free trade agreement.

title: Export orders on hold, US buyers seek 15-20% discount
content: US buyers are demanding 15-20% discounts from Indian exporters due to increased tariffs. Large retailers remain steady, while smaller exporters face order delays. The clothing and gems sectors are particularly impacted, with higher tariffs causing uncertainty. Despite challenges, Indian suppliers remain key partners for global retailers adjusting their strategies.

title: Microsoft VP tells Google employees: Don't come to me for jobs, go to….
content: Microsoft AI VP Nando de Freitas acknowledged Google's DeepMind for its new AI models while addressing restrictive employment contracts at DeepMind. He received multiple requests for help from distressed DeepMind employees regarding notice periods and noncompete agreements but directed them to internal leadership instead.

title: Tech entrepreneurs hit back at Goyal's remark on startups
content: Zepto's CEO Aadit Palicha defended the quick commerce sector against Union Minister Piyush Goyal's critique, emphasizing its economic contribution. Goyal urged startups to focus on high-tech fields. Ashneer Grover and TV Mohandas Pai also criticized the government's approach, highlighting the need for capital and investor support for deep-tech growth.

title: SC: Govt nod must to prosecute even officials accused of exceeding powers
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that public servants, including police officials, are protected from prosecution without prior government sanction, even when they exceed their official powers. This protection applies as long as there is a reasonable connection between the alleged wrongdoing and their official duties.

title: USCIS' 'plain and straight message' to H1-B, Green Card and other visa applicants
content: USCIS has revised its policy to recognize only two biological sexes, male and female, aligning with President Trump's 2025 executive order. Effective April 2, this change applies to all immigration benefit requests. The determination of sex will be based on birth certificates, and discrepancies may lead to processing delays.

title: Birla chides Sonia for remarks on Waqf Bill, Cong says Parl is now Modi's durbar
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla rebuked Sonia Gandhi's claim that the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2025 was 'bulldozed' through Parliament, asserting rules were followed. Extensive debate and voting occurred. Protests ensued from Congress as government faced criticism over US tariffs on Indian goods, with Rahul Gandhi warning of severe economic impact and demanding action from PM Modi.

title: LinkedIn co-founder to employees: Go home, have dinner with family
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman has defended the intense work ethic required for startup success, emphasizing that employees needed to continue working after family dinners during the company's early days. Hoffman argues that work-life balance is not feasible in startups, highlighting the significant rewards for those who embrace the demanding culture.

title: Bokaro Steel City shuts down over man’s death in lathicharge, production stopped
content: Massive protests in Bokaro steel city over permanent jobs and a CISF lathicharge led to the death of a youth, causing significant disruption. The plant ceased production, with angry demonstrators blocking roads and setting vehicles ablaze, resulting in substantial financial losses and a tense standoff.

title: RS passes waqf bill 128-95 as BJD boosts NDA numbers
content: The Rajya Sabha passed the Waqf (Amendment) Bill after a 15-hour debate, with 128 votes in favor and 95 against. The bill, already approved by the Lok Sabha, now awaits the President's assent. Minority affairs minister Kiren Rijiju defended the bill, asserting it involves both Muslims and non-Muslims.

title: President has withheld nod to TN bill on NEET-based admissions: Stalin
content: A new dispute has arisen over President Droupadi Murmu withholding assent to Tamil Nadu's bill for MBBS admissions based on Class XII marks instead of NEET scores. Chief Minister M K Stalin criticized this action, calling it authoritarian, and announced a meeting on April 9 to decide the next steps. He highlighted the bill's rejection despite state clarifications.

title: SC to examine if worship Act applies to Shahi Idgah
content: SC will examine the different arguments from Hindu and Muslim sides on the applicability of the Places of Worship Act, 1991 to the Mathura Shahi Idgah-Srikrishna Janmasthan dispute. Muslim side claims the suits violate the PoW Act, while Hindus argue it's protected under the ASI Act.

title: Tsunami warning issued after 6.9-magnitude earthquake strikes Papua New Guinea
content: A tsunami warning was issued for Papua New Guinea after a 6.9-magnitude earthquake hit off New Britain Island. The quake occurred at a depth of 10 kilometers. Waves between one and three meters were expected, with potential for smaller waves in the Solomon Islands.

title: SC on Delhi HC ruling: Should courts be so touchy about criticism?
content: The Supreme Court questioned the Delhi high court's order urging Wikimedia to remove a page criticizing judiciary proceedings. The bench stated such removal orders should only be issued if content is deemed contemptuous, not merely critical. Wikimedia opposed the HC order, emphasizing its importance for media freedom, referencing a defamation case by ANI. The page is already removed.

title: Trump bravado as US market continues to tank after China retaliates
content: Donald Trump responded to China's 34% retaliatory tariffs, causing US stocks to plunge. Despite his confidence in strong job numbers, American investors faced heavy losses. Trump hinted at possible negotiations despite earlier directives. He claimed other nations were willing to negotiate on tariffs. With US markets in turmoil, some US lawmakers challenge his approach.

title: India promises to support Myanmar towards switch to democratic future
content: PM Narendra Modi emphasized the need for early restoration of democracy in Myanmar during a meeting with junta chief Senior General Min Aung Hlaing. Modi expressed condolences for the recent earthquake and discussed India's humanitarian efforts. Both leaders agreed on cooperation against insurgent activities and crimes along the India-Myanmar border.

title: Annamalai says not in race for TN chief post: Is BJP eyeing AIADMK tie-up?
content: The BJP in Tamil Nadu may be adjusting its political strategy, as state BJP president K Annamalai announced he is not contesting for re-election. This development follows Annamalai's controversial comments about late AIADMK leader Jayalalithaa and potential talks of reviving a BJP-AIADMK alliance ahead of the assembly elections.

title: Window opens for fuel price cut as US-China tariff war trips oil prices
content: Oil prices hit their lowest since mid-2021, influenced by China's tariff retaliation against the US and OPEC+'s decision to increase production. This decline offers India an opportunity to lower fuel prices, easing inflationary pressures and reducing import costs. Lower fuel costs could benefit the economy and households.

title: Ram Navami: Jharkhand cuts power on rally route, draws SC's displeasure
content: The Supreme Court disapproved Jharkhand's decision to cut power for 10 hours during Ram Navami processions and instructed minimizing the outage to the barest minimum while maintaining essential services. The state cited past electrocution incidents as the reason for this precautionary measure.

title: Waqf Bill: Poll-bound Bihar to be ‘test case’ for NDA
content: With the Waqf Amendment Bill's passage, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's JD(U) faces potential backlash from the Muslim community, comprising 18% of the state's population. Despite internal dissent and past election losses, the party remains focused on promoting its minority welfare initiatives.

title: Trump's tariffs cause global shockwaves, but India may be among least vulnerable
content: US President Donald Trump has announced reciprocal tariff on all foreign goods starting April 2025. This move could potentially shake up global trade dynamics. However, experts suggest India may experience minimal impact.

title: Isro’s POEM-4, from SpaDeX mission, re-enters Earth’s atmosphere
content: Isro confirmed the successful re-entry of the PSLV Orbital Experimental Module (POEM-4) into Earth’s atmosphere, impacting the Indian Ocean on April 4, 2025. Launched as part of the SpaDeX mission, POEM-4 hosted 24 payloads and undertook key experiments, enhancing debris mitigation and sustainable space operations as part of the Debris Free Space Mission (DFSM).

title: Liv Morgan, Dominik Mysterio dazzle Netflix promotional event in Indian attire
content: WWE stars Liv Morgan and Dominik Mysterio impressed Mumbai crowds with their traditional Indian attire while promoting WWE's new partnership with Netflix. WWE content will transition exclusively to Netflix from April 1, 2025, enhancing accessibility for Indian fans and offering Hindi commentary and exclusive content.

title: IPL 2025: Rathi's tight spell trumps Pandya as LSG down MI
content: Lucknow Super Giants secured a thrilling 12-run victory over Mumbai Indians in IPL 2025, thanks to young leg-spinner Digvesh Singh Rathi's critical spell of 1/21. Rathi's performance under pressure disrupted MI's chase and highlighted him as a rising star. Mitchell Marsh's 60 and Hardik Pandya's five-wicket haul were other key highlights in the match.

title: Tytler confessed to his role in killing of 100 Sikhs: Witness
content: Manjit Singh GK informed a Delhi court he received a pen drive with an alleged confession from Congress functionary Jagdish Tytler about his role in the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. The court heard details of Tytler boasting about influential connections and large sums misappropriated by acquaintances.

title: Watershed moment, says PM Modi of Waqf bill passage
content: PM Narendra Modi commended the passage of the Waqf (Amendment) Bill and the Mussalman Wakf (Repeal) Bill by Parliament, highlighting their impact on transparency and socio-economic justice for marginalized Muslims. The legislation aims to eliminate corruption in waqf property management and benefit Muslim women and the underprivileged.

title: Don’t push us to the wall, Omar and allies tell LG over transfers
content: J&K's National Conference and Congress criticized LG Manoj Sinha for overstepping power boundaries with officer transfers, warning against further interference. A resolution condemned the Waqf Act. The coordination between the elected government and LG remains, but any future conflicts will be brought up in the assembly.

title: Drunken misconduct: Court orders community service for 4 convicts at Sufi shrine, school
content: A Srinagar court ordered four men, guilty of drinking and causing public nuisance, to perform community service instead of imprisonment. The community service includes cleaning at a Sufi shrine and a government girls' higher secondary school. The court considers this a more humane and progressive approach to justice.

title: Russia strikes Zelenskyy's hometown, kills 14
content: A Russian missile strike in Kryvyi Rig, Ukraine, killed 14 people and injured over 50, with the attack involving residential areas. President Zelenskyy stated that Russia seeks war and urged international pressure to end the conflict, emphasizing that the US, Europe, and global efforts are vital for peace.

title: Digvesh Rathi courts controversy again with fiery send-off against MI
content: Lucknow Super Giants spinner Digvesh Rathi made headlines again for his celebratory send-off after dismissing Mumbai Indians' Naman Dhir. Despite a prior fine for a similar action, Rathi repeated his aggressive celebration, leading to debate over potential further disciplinary action. With two send-offs in consecutive games, Rathi's behaviour may prompt sterner consequences from the league.

title: Centre downgrades security cover for ex-PM Manmohan Singh's wife
content: The Centre has downgraded Gursharan Kaur's security cover from Z-plus to Z, following a review of her threat perception. This change comes after the passing of former PM Manmohan Singh in 2024. CRPF will continue to provide protection, albeit with fewer personnel and a scaled-down protocol.

title: Protests & petitions: Multipronged oppn erupts against Waqf Bill
content: The Waqf Amendment Bill 2025 sparked large-scale protests across India, including Ahmedabad, Kolkata, and Chennai, after it cleared Parliament. Leaders of AIMIM and Congress challenged its constitutionality in the Supreme Court. The Opposition and several leaders criticized the Bill's passage and its potential impact on religious rights.

title: Will Cody Bellinger play today against Pittsburgh Pirates? Latest update
content: The New York Yankees are awaiting the final decision on Cody Bellinger's availability for today's game against the Pittsburgh Pirates due to a recent hamstring strain. Bellinger has been undergoing light training, and a last-minute check-up will determine his participation.

title: ICMR team blames bird flu and other factors for Narasaraopet girl’s death
content: Consuming undercooked meat, poor immunity and unhygienic living conditions have been identified as the other causes for the death, the team members say

title: West Bengal teachers’ appointment cancellation: WBSSC says cannot complete recruitment in three months
content: West Bengal School Service Commission (WBSSC) chairperson Siddhartha Majumdar told journalists that the commission would seek legal advice on who can take the fresh tests

title: Students get tips on transforming innovative ideas into business at ‘Udyavishk-2K25’
content: 10-day workshop on ‘Student Innovation and Entrepreneurship’ begins at PVP Siddhartha Institute of Technology in Vijayawada

title: Hyderabad gears up for Ram Navami Shobha Yatra amid tight security
content: In anticipation of the large-scale participation, Hyderabad Police are taking extensive security measures

title: Pregnant Pune woman dies after ‘treatment denied’, CM orders inquiry
content: On March 31, Tanisha seven-months pregnant with twins and wife of the personal secretary of a BJP MLC, Amit Gorkhe, died after the Deenanath Mangeshkar Hospital, a charitable trust hospital, allegedly refused emergency treatment, demanding ₹20 lakh per baby for admission.

title: Matrilineal Meghalaya attracting more girls to IIM-Shillong
content: The institute, fifth among 20 IIMs in India in terms of graduation outcome, has maintained its 100% placement record

title: Congress’s Hooda flays Haryana BJP over hike in electricity rates
content: The BJP government increasing the electricity rates has exposed the party’s anti-people stance, alleges Mr. Hooda

title: Hoteliers thank government for reducing bar license fees in Andhra Pradesh
content: Members of Andhra Pradesh Hotels Association have expressed their gratitude to the government for heeding their plea and reducing the bar license fees for three-star and above hotels to ₹25 lakh from ₹66 lakh.

title: Sharmila demands White Paper on height of Polavaram project
content: Addressing the media here, Ms. Sharmila said the full storage capacity of the project was reduced from 45 metres to 41 metres, reducing what had been designed to be the lifeline of Andhra Pradesh into a barrage

title: Muslim-majority village elects Hindu woman as sarpanch
content: Election will send message of communal harmony across the region, says new chief of Siroli panchayat in Haryana’s Nuh

title: Rohit Sharma's knee injury raises concerns as viral video sparks worry
content: Rohit Sharma missed the crucial IPL 2025 match against Lucknow Super Giants due to a knee injury sustained during practice. The incident raised concerns after visuals of him struggling surfaced online. MI shifted their strategy under Hardik Pandya's captaincy, who achieved a remarkable five-wicket haul amidst the swirling questions on Rohit's fitness.

title: Hardik Pandya creates history, becomes first IPL captain to take a fifer
content: Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya made history by becoming the first IPL captain to take a five-wicket haul. He took 5 wickets for 36 runs against Lucknow Super Giants. Pandya's spell was crucial in restricting LSG to a total of 203/8. This achievement is the best T20 performance of his career.

title: AIMPLB seeks appointment with president to express concern over Waqf Bill passed by Parliament
content: The Board has requested the President that "given the gravity of the matter", she grant it an early appointment convenient so that it may present its concerns and discuss possible resolutions within the Constitutional framework.

title: Sickle Cell Anaemia prevalence could be higher in the country, says CCMB scientist
content: A National Sickle Cell Anaemia Elimination Mission was launched in July 2023 to eliminate the disease by 2047 by aiming to screen 7 crore people below the age of 40 years in high prevalence tribal areas

title: Spotted deer killed in canine attack, another strays into residential locality
content: UoH students allege that the spotted deer lost their hideout due to clearance of greenery in 100 acres of Kancha Gachibowli, and hence are more vulnerable to canine attacks

title: PSLV Orbital Experimental Module makes atmospheric re-entry: ISRO
content: On December 30, 2024, ISRO’s PSLV-C60 launched twin SPADEX satellites, and after injecting the satellites at 475 km altitude, the specially configured upper stage (PS4) of PSLV-C60 (called PSLV Orbital Experimental Module in short POEM-4) was also almost in the same orbit.

title: CCMB’s sickle cell anaemia toolkit rolls out in tribal heartland of Jharkhand
content: The pilot project is being taken up in three districts of East and West Singhbhum and Seraikela-Kharsawan districts where about two lakh people from among the vulnerable tribal groups will be screened

title: Modified multi-visceral transplant done to treat intestinal disorder at private hospital in Chennai
content: MGM Healthcare successfully performed the procedure, saving the life of a 32-year-old patient from Kerala

title: LDF, UDF criticise ED searches on Gokulam Gopalan
content: Attacks on L2: Empuraan amounted to a forced intervention in Kerala’s cultural sphere, says T.P. Ramakrishnan

title: "They Played It Wrong, Panicked": Trump On China's Tariff Retaliation
content: President Donald Trump goaded a "panicked" China on Friday after the chief US economic rival retaliated against his tariffs and he dismissed stock market panic over the growing global trade war, touting the chance to "get rich."

title: "No Mosques Will Be Touched": BJP's Ravi Shankar Prasad On Waqf Bill
content: The Waqf (Amendment) Bill, which has been cleared by both the Lok Sabha and the Rajya Sabha after heated, marathon debates, will benefit women from the Muslim community and ensure transparency, BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad has said.

title: US Moves Largest B-2 Bomber Fleet, 3 Aircraft Carriers To Indo-Pacific
content: While the world was busy figuring out Donald Trump's reciprocal tariff move and its fallout, the United States quietly made a massive military move in the Indian Ocean and Indo-Pacific region.

title: Trump Tariff Effect: Stock Meltdown Fuels Worst Day At Markets Since Covid
content: The "America First" trade is unraveling in the sweeping turmoil in global markets, with stocks acutely exposed to the US economy sinking alongside the dollar.

title: US Wedges Its Way In, Says "Greenland Does Not Want To Be Part Of Denmark"
content: As Greenland and Denmark, of which it is a part, have vociferously rejected Donald Trump's "strategic buyout" proposal, Washington has struck back, trying to wedge its way in.

title: K Annamalai To Step Down As Tamil Nadu BJP Chief? He Says...
content: Adding fuel to speculation that he may be replaced as the president of the Tamil Nadu BJP, K Annamalai has said that he is not in the running to be the next state chief of the party.

title: Trump Fires National Security Agency Director Timothy Haugh: Report
content: US President Donald Trump fired General Timothy Haugh as director of the National Security Agency, in a national security purge that sources said on Friday included more than a dozen staff at the White House national security council.

title: How Trump's Tariffs Are Crushing Apple's 'Make In India' Dream
content: The US is India's largest trading partner, accounting for 18% of total goods exports. The 26% tariff could severely affect electronics shipments, profitability, and supply chains.

title: "Dangerous": Harvard Professor Sounds Alert As Markets Lose Trillions
content: US stock futures fell sharply today, signalling more losses on Wall Street, after China retaliated with fresh tariffs a day after the Trump administration's sweeping levies knocked off $2.4 trillion from US equities.

title: India's Homegrown Trainer Aircraft 'Hansa NG' Set To Soar Higher
content: India's aviation sector is booming with over 10 crore passengers flying every year. To keep up with the demand, India needs at least 30,000 new pilots in the next few years.

title: Tilak Retired Out During MI's Run Chase vs LSG. Shocking Decision Explained
content: Mumbai Indians decided to retire out Tilak Varma with seven balls remaining in their run chase against Lucknow Super Giants during IPL 2025 match.

title: Man Serves Jail Time Over Wife's Murder, She Turns Up Alive In Court
content: A court here has ordered the Superintendent of Police (SP) to submit a complete report before April 17 in connection with a case in which a woman, allegedly murdered by her husband in 2020, has now appeared before it-alive.

title: Hardik's All-Round Show In Vain As LSG Register Thrilling Win Against MI
content: Lucknow Super Giants vs Mumbai Indians Highlights, IPL 2025: Rishabh Pant-led LSG beat Hardik Pandya-led MI by 12 runs in a nail-biter.

title: Watch: Microsoft CEOs Gates, Nadella And Ballmer 'Roasted' By Copilot AI
content: The conversation kicks off with Nadella asking the Copilot to "wrap it up by asking or maybe roast giving us each an AI roast?" to which Microsoft's AI-powered assistant says, "Alright, Satya. Let's spice it up."

title: Nuclear Powered Rockets May Make Trip To Mars Faster, More Efficient: Report
content: A revolution in spaceflight is in the offing. British startup Pulsar Fusion has unveiled its nuclear fusion-powered rocket, the Sunbird, CNN reported.

title: Immigration and Foreigners Bill gets president's assent, becomes law
content: The legislation empowers the central government to exert control over places that are "frequented by any foreigner" and requires the owner to close the premises, permit its use under specified conditions, or refuse admission to all or a "specified class" of foreigners.

title: Army’s MRSAM flight tested four times
content: According to DRDO, the MRSAM’s successfull interception and destruction of all designated targets “paved the way for operationalisation of weapon systems”.

title: Waqf Bill: Narrow margin of defeat in Rajya Sabha surprises Opposition
content: The INDIA bloc has only 81 members and at least six of them were absent during voting; additional votes were contributed by AIADMK and the non-INDIA bloc Opposition parties such as BJD, YSR Congress and BRS

title: NIA opposes Anand Teltumbde’s plea to travel abroad, cites risk of absconding
content: The accused scholar filed a plea to travel to the Netherlands and the U.K. for academic reasons; NIA denied on the grounds of his alleged involvment with CPI (Maoist).

title: Maharashtra govt to crack down on ‘huge Waqf land scam’: CM Fadnavis
content: Waqf bill has nothing to do with Hindutva, says Fadnavis, adding that provisions of the amended law are in the ‘constitutional spirit of a democratic, socialist Republic of India’

title: Governor gives Karnataka govt. one-month deadline to appoint RDPR varsity Vice-Chancellor
content: Thaawarchand Gehlot said in his letter addressed to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah that until the Karnataka State Rural Development and Panchayat Raj University (Amendment) Bill is cleared, the vice-chancellor has to be appointed as per the existing law

title: Rahul Gandhi to visit Bihar on April 7; Jan Suraaj Party to hold rally in Patna on April 11
content: Congress party leader is expected to participate in a seminar on “Safeguarding the Constitution” in Patna and may also visit Begusarai to support Kanhaiya Kumar’s padayatra

title: Teacher transferred; two cooks suspended for caning student over egg distribution in Tiruvannamalai
content: A probe led by the Block Educational Officer, found the student asked about the non-distribution of eggs, when he along with other students saw racks of eggs in the kitchen

title: Activists call for ceasefire after Maoists make conditional offer for peace talks
content: The government must stop war on the ground immediately, Maoists must end hostilities against State forces, use of IEDs, activists say; insist residents of tribal districts must be top priority in any peace talks

title: Trump tariffs | Sectors in India that find themselves in a spotlight
content: The White House held these tariffs strived to “strengthen the international economic position of United States and protect American workers”

title: Office space leasing in Chennai sees growth, records 2.6 million sq.ft in first quarter of 2025
content: CBRE South Asia Private Limited, in its report, says key sectors that drove demand include technology (32%), fast-moving consumer goods and retail (19%), and flexible space operators (14%)

title: Four more JD(U) leaders resign after party supports Waqf Bill
content: In one of the resignation letters, it is mentioned that its effect would be visible in the upcoming Bihar Assembly election 2025 and soon there will be a stir in JD(U) due to widespread discontent

title: Jaipur court convicts four persons in 2008 live bomb case
content: The live bomb detected near the Ramchandra temple in Chandpole Bazaar, for which the four persons were held guilty, was defused before it could explode

title: BSP does not support the Waqf Bill, says Mayawati
content: Former U.P. CM questions the government’s extreme hurry in clearing the Bill and states that the people needed more time to understand the Bill in its entirety

title: Manipur crisis: Kuki-Zo, Meitei civil society groups to meet in Delhi
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah says both the communities in Manipur should understand that dialogue is the only way forward and the Union government is not in favour of continuing President’s Rule even for a single day

title: Union Minister inaugurates public utilities funded by RVF in West Godavari district
content: Drinking water pond, RO water plant, and classrooms were among the facilities provided by the foundation at Ganapavaram village and Unguturu Assembly constituency

title: Congress launches Manmohan Singh Fellowship programme to help professionals transition into politics
content: Under the fellowship, 50 mid-career professionals will be chosen every year and mentored by senior party leaders from professional backgrounds;  the chosen professionals should have spent a minimum 10 years, attained a certain level of financial security and are passionate about building a progressive India

title: Srinagar’s Jama Masjid closed for Friday prayers; NC MP says ‘denied space to speak on Waqf Bill’
content: Terming the Bill as “state-sponsored dispossession”, a National Conference MP said the ruling BJP pushed the Bill through Parliament without allowing space for critics to “voice their concerns”

title: A cultural treat on a Rajamahendravaram street
content: The works of artists and traditional artisans stole the hearts of art lovers in the city at the Amaravathi Chitra Kala Veedhi, a national art festival, held along the stretch of the Central Prison

title: Seafood exports from A.P. hit following  Trump’s tariff hike
content: Shipment of seafood products was halted for the last 24 hours on Friday; farmers, exporters keeping their fingers crossed as duty has been raised to 26 per cent

title: Kadapa Steel Plant not off agenda, says A.P. Industries Minister Bharath
content: He and Minister for MSMEs Srinivas release operational guidelines and launch Early Bird Portal pertaining to three policies

title: Revenue Minister launches slot booking service at 26 sub-registrar offices in Andhra Pradesh
content: Sellers, buyers, and witnesses can visit the office at the chosen time and complete the registration process smoothly, says Satya Prasad

title: Govt. to prioritise toilet construction in villages within boundaries of eco-sensitive zones to reduce human-animal conflict
content: The order comes in response to wildlife biologist Sanjay Gubbi’s recent letter to Priyank Kharge, urging him to prioritise villages within eco-sensitive zones for essential sanitation initiatives

title: ‘Efforts to develop harmonious relationships with neighbouring states should increase’
content: Seven candidates got D.Lit and 198 candidates got Ph.D degrees at the convocation at the 33rd Convocation of Kannada University in Hampi

title: Set up 100-bed hospitals in every Assembly constituency and offer need-based virtual services at PHCs, CHCs, Andhra Pradesh CM Naidu tells officials
content: Incentives and subsidies can be given to the private firms that come forward to construct and operate these hospitals under PPP model, he says; he also asks officials to take steps to establish a Mega Global MediCity Project in Amaravati

title: Kerala govt. notifies Energy Conservation and Sustainable Building Code Rules
content: The provisions are applicable to commercial buildings with a connected load of 100 kW or more, or a contract demand of 120 kVA or more

title: Chief Minister moots comprehensive policy to make education more efficient and effective
content: The Education Commission asked to recommend policies to revamp the education system in the State; Chief Minister emphasised that the document should  reflect the ground realities and effort be made to see that the recommendations are implementable

title: Civil Supplies Minister promises to procure every paddy grain from farmers
content: The government had procured 74,000 metric tonnes of paddy from 7,000 farmers and ₹154 crore was credited to the farmers’ accounts within 24-48 hours, says Nadendla Manohar

title: Asaduddin Owaisi challenges waqf legislation in Supreme Court
content: Consultation in connection with legal recourse and protest against waqf legislation underway: All India Muslim Personal Law Board

title: 263 polling booths, including 59 new ones, likely for Nilambur bypoll
content: New permanent polling booths will be established in the place of auxiliary booths for areas with large voter population ahead of the Nilambur by-election.

title: Telangana to move Supreme Court against A.P.’s Godavari-Krishna link projects, says Minister
content: The State won’t remain a mute spectator to construction of illegal projects to divert river waters to non-basin areas at the cost of needs in basin areas in Telangana, says Uttam Kumar Reddy

title: 70% of maternal deaths in Karnataka between April and December of 2024 were preventable, finds audit report
content: The report was submitted by a government-constituted committee which was formed following the maternal deaths in Ballari

title: Trial traffic reforms on Chalakudy national highway from April 5
content: Traffic snarl-ups on the Chalakudy-Chirangara section of the National Highway 544 due to work on underpasses and overbridges

title: De Bruyne to leave Man City at end of season
content: Kevin De Bruyne has announced that he will leave the club at the end of the season . the england international's contract at the Etihad Stadium expires in the summer . he said on friday that the club will leave as a free agent .

title: Ranking the 15 best players: From Bueckers and Betts to Paopao and Strong
content: the top 15 players in women's college basketball will compete in the final four . "nBA Today" has ranked the top players in men's basketball throughout the season . it's time to see the very best on the biggest stage . the WNBA draft pick is in her fourth final Four .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Jets take over the top spot, plus every team's performance vs. projections
content: the blues beat the Penguins for their 11th win in a row . there are less than two weeks left in the 2024-25 NHL regular season . the playoff field continues to be whittled down, with teams clinching berths .

title: Your guide to the men's Final Four: Auburn-Florida, Duke-Houston (with picks!)
content: a showdown of the top two teams from the best conference in men's college basketball . our experts are here to break down how each team can win its final four matchup . read their analysis for Florida vs. Auburn .

title: Harry Kane is on a mission to finally end his long personal trophy drought
content: despite winning trophies and featuring in five finals, Harry Kane has never won a major club trophy . the 33-time german league champion has never tasted victory in a competition . he says he is a man on a mission to win silverware of note . his first year with Bayern Munich ended trophy-less, an unusual feat .
